senselogic.sitevision.api.script

Interface RestApiFactory<O>

  • Type Parameters:
    O - script object

    @Requireable(value="RestApiFactory")
public interface RestApiFactory<O>
    Factory for creating server-side invokers of the local Sitevision REST API.

    REST siblings note!

    • Server-side invoke of a local RESTApp should typically be handled via RestAppInvoker.
    • Invoking external REST API:s should typically be handled via Requester.
    Since:
    Sitevision 2024.04.2
    Author:
    Magnus LÃ¶vgren

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      VersionedRestApi<O> getOfflineRestApi()
      Gets the Versioned RestApi utility for the OFFLINE version.
      VersionedRestApi<O> getOnlineRestApi()
      Gets the Versioned RestApi utility for the ONLINE version.
      RestApi<O> getRestApi()
      Gets the RestApi utility.

    • Method Detail

      • getRestApi

        RestApi<O> getRestApi()
        Gets the RestApi utility.

        The returned utility invokes the local REST API in current version.

        Returns:
        the RestApi utility

      • getOnlineRestApi

        VersionedRestApi<O> getOnlineRestApi()
        Gets the Versioned RestApi utility for the ONLINE version.

        The returned utility always invokes the local REST API in the ONLINE version.

        Related info: URI prefix for the REST API in the ONLINE version is: /rest-api/1/1/

        Returns:
        the VersionedRestApi for the ONLINE version

      • getOfflineRestApi

        VersionedRestApi<O> getOfflineRestApi()
        Gets the Versioned RestApi utility for the OFFLINE version.

        The returned utility always invokes the local REST API in the OFFLINE version.

        Related info: URI prefix for the REST API in the OFFLINE version is: /rest-api/1/0/

        Returns:
        the VersionedRestApi for the OFFLINE version

Sitevision - Portal and Content Management Made Easy
Sitevision is an advanced Java enterprise portal product and a portlet container (JSR 286) that implements Java Content Repository (JSR 283).
